question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of meristematic tissue?
A student observes a plant tissue under a microscope and finds that the cells are loosely arranged with large intercellular spaces. The tissue most likely is:
Which type of tissue provides flexibility to plants, allowing them to bend without breaking?
The husk of a coconut is made up of which type of tissue?
Which of the following is NOT a component of xylem?
Which tissue is responsible for transporting food from leaves to other parts of the plant?
Which of the following is a characteristic of the epidermis in desert plants?
Stomata are enclosed by two kidney-shaped cells called:
Which of the following is NOT a function of stomata?
Cork cells are impervious to gases and water due to the presence of:
Which type of animal tissue forms a barrier to keep different body systems separate?
The lining of the mouth and oesophagus is made up of which type of epithelium?
Which type of epithelium facilitates movement across the epithelial barrier and is found in the inner lining of the intestine?
Which type of epithelium has hair-like projections called cilia that help in clearing mucus?
Which type of epithelium forms the lining of kidney tubules and provides mechanical support?
Which of the following is NOT a function of connective tissue?
Which type of connective tissue has a fluid matrix called plasma?
Which type of connective tissue is strong and non-flexible, forming the framework of the body?
Which type of connective tissue connects bones to each other and is very elastic?
Which type of connective tissue connects muscles to bones and has great strength but limited flexibility?
Which type of connective tissue smoothens bone surfaces at joints and is also present in the nose and ear?
Which type of connective tissue fills the space inside organs, supports internal organs, and helps in tissue repair?
Which type of connective tissue stores fat and acts as an insulator?
Which type of muscle tissue is responsible for voluntary movements like walking and running?
Which type of muscle tissue is responsible for involuntary movements like the movement of food in the alimentary canal?
Which type of muscle tissue is found in the heart and shows rhythmic contraction and relaxation throughout life?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of striated muscle?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of smooth muscle?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of cardiac muscle?
Which type of tissue is highly specialized for being stimulated and transmitting stimuli rapidly within the body?
The basic unit of nervous tissue is called:
Which part of a neuron is a long, thin process that carries nerve impulses away from the cell body?
Which part of a neuron receives signals from other neurons?
The signal that passes along a nerve fiber is called:
The functional combination of nerve and muscle tissue enables animals to:

options.c: Move rapidly in response to stimuli

question: Which of the following is a function of the epithelial tissue in the respiratory tract?
Which type of connective tissue is responsible for the storage of minerals like calcium and phosphorus?
Which type of muscle tissue is responsible for the movement of the iris in the eye?
Which type of tissue is responsible for the transmission of nerve impulses from the brain to the muscles?
Which type of cell in nervous tissue is responsible for receiving signals from other neurons?
Which type of connective tissue is found in the bone marrow and helps in the production of blood cells?
Which of the following is NOT a type of epithelial tissue?
Which type of muscle tissue is responsible for the peristaltic movement of food in the digestive system?
Which of the following is a function of the epidermis in plants?
Which type of connective tissue forms the tendons that connect muscles to bones?
